de.nixosoft.jlr

Class JLRGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.nixosoft.jlr.JLRGenerator

  • public class JLRGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    The JLRGenerator is used to convert a *.tex file to a *.pdf file.
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Matthias Walter (matthias .walter@nixo-soft.de)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JLRGenerator()
      Constructs a JLRConverter.

    • Method Detail

      • getErrorMessage

        public java.lang.String getErrorMessage()
        Returns an error message if the generation fails.
        Returns:
        The error message as a String

      • getOutputStream

        public java.lang.String getOutputStream()
        Returns the output messages of pdfLaTeX.
        Returns:
        The output messages as a String. Returns an empty string if there is no output.

      • getPDF

        public java.io.File getPDF()
        Returns the PDF file.
        Returns:
        The PDF file as File. Returns null if PDF generation fails.

      • deleteTempFiles

        public void deleteTempFiles(boolean deleteTempTex,
                   boolean deleteAux,
                   boolean deleteLog)
        Sets the state of the deletion for the temporary files (tex/aux/log).
        By default it's set to false.
        Parameters:
        deleteTempTex - true if the *.tex file shall be deleted after generating the pdf, false otherwise
        deleteAux - true if the *.aux file shall be deleted after generating the pdf, false otherwise
        deleteLog - true if the *.log file shall be deleted after generating the pdf, false otherwise

      • generate

        public boolean generate(java.io.File inputFile,
               java.io.File outputPath,
               java.io.File workingDirectory)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Converts a *.tex file to a *.pdf file using pdfLaTeX. It runs 3 times for solving problems with Cross-References.
        Parameters:
        inputFile - The *.tex file
        outputPath - The output path (more exactly: the directory) where the *.pdf file is going to be created.
        workingDirectory - The directory where pdfLaTeX shall be executed
        Returns:
        true if the converting was successful, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

      • generate

        public boolean generate(int cycles,
               java.io.File inputFile,
               java.io.File outputPath,
               java.io.File workingDirectory)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Converts a *.tex file to a *.pdf file using pdfLaTeX.
        Parameters:
        cycles - Determines how many times pdfLatex should run (for solving Cross-References)
        inputFile - The *.tex file
        outputPath - The output path (more exactly: the directory) where the *.pdf file is going to be created.
        workingDirectory - The directory where pdfLaTeX shall be executed
        Returns:
        true if the converting was successful, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

      • generate

        public boolean generate(java.io.File pdfLatex,
               java.io.File inputFile,
               java.io.File outputPath,
               java.io.File workingDirectory)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Converts a *.tex file to a *.pdf file using pdfLaTeX. It runs 3 times for solving problems with Cross-References.

        This function could be interesting for a portable LaTeX distribution.

        Parameters:
        pdfLatex - The path to the executable pdfLaTeX file (this path has to include the file)
        inputFile - The *.tex file
        outputPath - The output path (more exactly: the directory) where the *.pdf file is going to be created.
        workingDirectory - The directory where pdfLaTeX shall be executed
        Returns:
        true if the converting was successful, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

      • generate

        public boolean generate(java.io.File pdfLatex,
               int cycles,
               java.io.File inputFile,
               java.io.File outputPath,
               java.io.File workingDirectory)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Converts a *.tex file to a *.pdf file using pdfLaTeX.

        This function could be interesting for a portable LaTeX distribution.

        Parameters:
        pdfLatex - The path to the executable pdfLaTeX file (this path has to include the file)
        cycles - Determines how many times pdfLatex should run (for solving Cross-References)
        inputFile - The *.tex file
        outputPath - The output path (more exactly: the directory) where the *.pdf file is going to be created.
        workingDirectory - The directory where pdfLaTeX shall be executed
        Returns:
        true if the converting was successful, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs
